title: Ukraine PM Denys Shmyhal resigns as Zelensky backs Yulia Svyrydenko as successor
snippet: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal handed in his resignation on Tuesday after the country's President Volodymyr Zelensky decided to nominate First Deputy Prime Minister Yuliia Svyrydenko to succeed him in the role.

title: Ukraine's new PM takes charge of narrower cabinet of Zelensky loyalists
snippet: Yulia Svyrydenko, 39, who succeeds Denys Shmyhal and previously served as economy minister, is well regarded by the US administration, with whom she negotiated the critical minerals agreement.

title: Ukrainian PM Resigns Amid Major Government Reshuffle
snippet: Yulia Svyrydenko, currently the first deputy prime minister, is expected to take over from Denys Shmyhal, who tendered his resignation as prime minister on July 15, 2025 as part of a major government reshuffle.
